result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:34 AM Defendant Scott R Goral in court.  Attorney Jeremy J Guza in court for Scott R Goral. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Atty Guza was just retained, made a discovery demand, and asks for another date. 
State will forward pre-trial offer.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Atty Guza appears on behalf of the Defendant

Adjustment Number: 22A 036523,
Payable Number: 475439,
Receipt Number: 22R 039862,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Scott R Goral in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant confirms he is not currently represented by counsel, but is in the process of obtaining private counsel. Defendant hopes he can obtain counsel in 4 weeks. 

Court advises of right to an attorney, and gives PD and court appointed counsel information. 

Court will set another date.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on July 21st, 2022.

Apply cash bail previously posted.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

03:15 PM Defendant Scott R Goral in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
